elements.title: Supermarine S.4 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Supermarine S.4 (pictured) was built to race in the 1925 Schneider Trophy but crashed during it?

elements.title: Gogu Rădulescu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gogu Rădulescu, a member of the Romanian Communist Party central committee, was allegedly spied on by his colleagues through Lăutari performers, called upon to "sing him the blues"?

elements.title: Possession (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although Andrzej Żuławski's film Possession is referred to as a psychological drama and horror, its genre is still a matter of controversy?

elements.title: debut single (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Thin Lizzy's debut single only sold 283 copies?

elements.title: Kakusan-ni (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kakusan-ni was the founding abbess of a Buddhist convent that was a refuge for women running away from their husbands?

elements.title: Lone Mountain Cemetery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Phineas Gage was buried in Lone Mountain Cemetery twice, once without his head, before being relocated still without his head?

elements.title: Jessica Martin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jessica Martin has played both a punk werewolf and the voice of the Queen in Doctor Who?

elements.title: Burlington Union Station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Burlington Union Station is home to winged monkeys?
